title: 112_hr4265
content: The Act is titled the "Shared Responsibility in Preserving America's Future Act" and includes a surtax on millionaires contingent on the passage of a balanced budget amendment or spending limit amendment. This surtax is added as a new part to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. For taxable years between 2012 and 2023, non-corporate taxpayers are subject to a 5% tax on modified adjusted gross income exceeding $1,000,000, with adjustments for inflation starting from 2013. For taxable years between 2012 and 2023, non-corporate taxpayers are subject to a 5% tax on modified adjusted gross income exceeding $1,000,000, with adjustments for inflation starting from 2013. The threshold amount for married individuals filing separately is one-half of the amount for the taxable year. Modified adjusted gross income is calculated by reducing adjusted gross income by the excess of gross income from a non-passive trade or business. The IRS regulations under section 469(c) require taxpayers to pay wages to at least 1 full-time equivalent employee for income deductions. Special rules apply to nonresident alien individuals and citizens living abroad under section 871(b). Regulations similar to section 469(l) are prescribed for determining income taken into account. The tax imposed under this section is subject to certain exceptions, such as for citizens and residents living abroad, charitable trusts, and it is not considered tax imposed by this chapter for specific purposes. Additionally, the application of this section is contingent on a Balanced Budget or Spending Limit Amendment. The application of section 55 is contingent on a Balanced Budget or Spending Limit Amendment. This section will not apply to any taxable year before the President certifies the submission of a proposed amendment to the Constitution of the United States for ratification. If the certification is not made before September 30, 2012, this section will not apply to any taxable year. Additionally, this section will not apply to any taxable year after December 31, 2017, unless such an amendment becomes valid through ratification. The amendment becomes valid as part of the Constitution of the United States through ratification. A clerical amendment is made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment on the surtax for millionaires is not considered a change in tax rate under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years starting after December 31, 2012.
